storyInfo: Amiya prevents the airship from crashing, and sees something unexpected. Theresis also obtains the Sarkaz's Originium that Theresa gave her life for.

attributes.content: Wait, this is... Babel?!
With the help of his friends, the puppet crossed the river of tears, and even the golden ocean behind them they didn't know about...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Finally, they set foot on land once again, and found that Plains of Hope.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Theresa, do you like the ending I came up with?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Of course I do.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The puppet's friends—that's my favorite part of your story.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: But... how did the story actually end, Theresa?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: ...Theresa?
I can't recall ever having this conversation with Theresa, but I've dreamed of it happening countless times.
It meant the story would finally get an ending it never had, and that the storyteller never left.
I want to tell her I already have the power to change how the story ends.
The question I wasn't able to answer back then, and the answer I've found—
I am willing and able to bear this crown.

attributes.options: Amiya!

attributes.content: 'Metal matter, fall like feather.'
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: There's no way we can stabilize this huge-ass thing! We'll end up a smear on the ground at this rate!
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Time to get to work, ancestor!
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: I am trying! Regaining control of this ship is no easy feat!
attributes.name: Revenant's Voice

attributes.content: Quit pretending! How were you so good at it when you were working for the Military Commission?
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Insolence! Treat your elders with more respect, young Sarkaz!
attributes.name: Revenant's Voice

attributes.content: We have to brace ourselves for the impact from the airship's emergency landing. Mon3tr, protect the Doctor and Amiya.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Dr. Kal'tsit... they need me.
Amiya, the puppet's friends never gave up on him. No matter how they suffered...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Whenever the puppet needs them, they'll show up, catch him, and walk him through his troubles together.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: That's what I wish for too. I hope I'll always be there whenever you need me.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: —She's looking at... me?
Theresa...?
But what we go through... things don't always go our way.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Some of the little puppet's friends will get lost while on their journey.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: But their collective memories will accompany their little puppet friend to the end.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Amiya... I will always be with you all.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: ...Regardless of what form I take.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Theresa—
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Are you... leaving?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: What are you saying, Amiya? I left long ago.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: What...?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: You're... not Theresa.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Amiya, the memories in your dreams are warm. But you should wake up now.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Return to your companions, Amiya. They need you.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Your journeys have yet to end.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: How did I end up here?
We just... left the Assimilated Universe—
I remember the airship returning to our familiar sky, Originium crystals covering the entire ship receding like the tide...
This is the most I can do with my incantations. I'm afraid there's no way to absorb all the impact force.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: I'm trying my best here! One more time, old coot!
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Mon3tr!
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Everyone... needs me...
What can I even do now...?
Every inch of the gigantic ship vibrates in a metallic shudder.
The airship's speed of descent slows down once more.
She uses everything Theresa has taught her with all her strength to prop up the monstrously huge vessel.
A warm power like a murmur from her dreams encircles Amiya.
She feels as if that person who left has returned, hugging her.
Theresa...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Amiya has never experienced a feeling like this.
The 'Civilight Eterna's power enveloping her, abundant and warm.
Is this an illusion? Or is she still dreaming?
Theresa...? Is that really you?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Well done, Amiya.
attributes.name: Theresa?

attributes.content: You have to believe in your comrades, and your own strength too.
attributes.name: Theresa?

attributes.content: We'll descend slowly.
attributes.name: Theresa?

attributes.content: Every Sarkaz on the battlefield raises their head, as if sensing a familiar aura.
The silhouette of a supposedly-dead King of Sarkaz appears in the radiance.
With a sigh, they no longer see her, only a gentle Cautus with a similar form to the person they were expecting to see.
We... landed safely, I guess? Was that old thing actually useful, or...
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Bunny? Why do you look like...?
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Wiš'adel...? What about me...?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Forget it!
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Did we end up in Londinium? The Shard doesn't seem so far away.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Yes... The airship is a huge target, so the Sarkaz stationed within the city will soon come looking for us.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: We'll have to evacuate as quickly as we can.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Hmph...
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: I have something better in mind.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Theresa... no, you're not...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: I'm the only one who can see you, right?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Yes. Others can see me as well, only if you wish it so.
attributes.name: Theresa's Phantom

attributes.content: Just who are you...?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: A promise.
attributes.name: Theresa's Phantom

attributes.content: Theresa promised to stay by your side and watch you grow up.
attributes.name: Theresa's Phantom

attributes.content: Theresa is gone forever, but she left a program inside the crown—I manifested in this form because of your emotions.
attributes.name: Theresa's Phantom

attributes.content: A promise, an emotion entrusted into the crown, a will that relies on 'Civilight Eterna' to exist.
Do you have any doubts, Amiya? I can answer them.
attributes.name: Theresa's Phantom

attributes.content: If Theresa truly left you here as her will...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: The story about the puppet, and its ending... What was it that Theresa wanted to tell me?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Theresa made up that story herself, and there are no records of it in any existing works.
attributes.name: Theresa's Phantom

attributes.content: So there is no way I can answer your question.
attributes.name: Theresa's Phantom

attributes.content: So...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: But you have surpassed her, as she wished.
attributes.name: Theresa's Phantom

attributes.content: What she wanted to say has already been passed on to you. It's up to you to decide what will happen next in the story.
attributes.name: Theresa's Phantom

attributes.content: Thank you... Theresa.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Did you guys see that? The Sarkaz airship fell from the sky!
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: The clouds—they're scattering!
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: The Sarkaz can't control the storm anymore!
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: Amiya and the Doctor did it.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: No matter how short or long this moment of safety lasts, we must seize the opportunity—
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Capture Silverrock Bluffs, and advance toward the city walls.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: ...Rout the Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: ...Today, the second time.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: We witnessed her departure.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: A great King of Sarkaz, a true hero.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: She initiated an unprecedented grand undertaking for the Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: And we... are witnesses, and participants.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: From the Royal Court camps to the War Council, and to the Military Commission of today—
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: We will never fall as long as war still goes on. We have already wrested enough victories for the Sarkaz over the past millennia.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: He looks up at the dreadful scene in the sky with only reverence.
The Victorians zealously chase after the phantom of victory while never understanding of why we crave war in the first place.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: ...'From death comes new life'.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Hah. This war has sated me.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: 'The 106th Assault Artillery Brigade has successfully regrouped with the 2nd and 8th Battalions of the Duke of Normandy's Grenadier Regiments!'
'9th Battalion Armored Corps and The Exemplars have seized control of Hill 92!'
'Anti-Witchcraft cannons back online!'
Mid-range communication has been restored.
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: Your Grace, the battlefield is back under our control.
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: ...What of him?
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: The Gastrell is severely damaged, and should still be—
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: Hold on, we just managed to locate it!
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: It's—right next to us!
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: Your Grace, an urgent telegram from the Duke of Gododdin.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: ...Have our forces dispatched to Duskglow River withdraw at once.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Yes, Your Grace.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Your Grace...
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: ...Were we late?
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: All frequencies... went down simultaneously. He blinded every single eye of ours.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: That Duke of Wellington...
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Many years ago, by the Duskglow River... he told me a day would come when nothing would be able to stop the advance of high-speed battleships.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: He's done it.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Your Grace, the Gastrell has paused its advance!
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: The Iron Duke's warships are forming up again!
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: Three light battleships have turned their guns toward—
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: Isn't that the Duke of Wellington's ship?
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: ––What the bloody hell are they doing?!
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: The Sarkaz have only just retreated, but he wants to start another war with the dukes right away?! Has he truly gone mad?!
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: The dead... that fire in their eyes...
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: The nearby 'Adjutant Hill' stops in his tracks.
The purple fire leaves from his eyes, floating to someplace higher, further away.
To shadows and smoke enshrouding an entire fleet of steel.
Your Royal Highness Eblana, are you ready?
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: Anytime.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Flame falls from the sky, rolling across the flagship's bow, burning the original flag instantly.
Similar fires blossom in purple one after the other on every ship in Wellington's fleet.
Huh? What day is it today? What's with the fireworks?
attributes.name: Taran Citizen

attributes.content: Heck, not just that—Isn't that the municipal building? What was that they just rolled down from up there—
attributes.name: Taran Citizen

attributes.content: It's a new flag.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: We worked so hard just for today, you know.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: So? Looks nice, doesn't it?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Thank you for the flower, Miss Reed! It's so pretty!
attributes.name: Taran Child

attributes.content: What are you looking at, Miss?
attributes.name: Taran Child

attributes.content: Um... we are quite a distance from Londinium, yes?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Could the ashes from the battlefield float this far?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: A spark falls on the Draco's fingertip.
The fleeting purple fades, leaving only a speck of dull grey ash.
...It's hot.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: ...Tara.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: After a century, we finally raise our flag once more on this land.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: We have proved our strength to the Sarkaz and the Victorians.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Here and now, no one will be able to stop us, to scorn us.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Tarans—my people, they shall become a force that can control the war, and shape the land.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: We shall let everyone see the coming of a new age.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: The Draco raises her hand, smiling at the land.
Every Taran flag flutters in unison.
A rich purple coalesces under the clouds—
Finally, it stands against the crimson storm and the still flickering golden light.
He really has no intention of letting us breathe.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Wellington...
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Do you truly hate Victoria, or...?
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Your Grace, an urgent telegram from the Duke of Gododdin.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: And the Duke of Normandy, as well as the Duke of Fife...
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Let them sit in their anxiety for a while.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Back then, we joined hands to confine this warmonger into a duke's attire. Now we have no choice but to suffer the consequences of our actions.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Go, fetch the proposal locked away in the first drawer on the right side of my desk.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: I wrote it myself... before I came to Londinium.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Will the Iron Duke... be willing to restart negotiations?
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: No, that's not it.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Victoria will no longer have an Iron Duke in future.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: But Caster may perhaps find a new powerful ally.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: By reforging an alliance with Wellington at this time?
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: This is in our best interests.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: He knows I will make this choice. He and King Gaeil's descendant... treat war and death like their bargaining chips.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: We must recognize Tara's independence if we don't wish to go to war on two fronts at this critical juncture.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Our soldiers and people will be furious once they find out about Wellington's betrayal. They won't accept our choice so easily either.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: ...Indeed.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: But what of it?
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: The people have always longed for a 'hero' that descends from the heavens to guide them.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: The Duke casts her gaze toward the battlefield below.
The soldiers are excitedly chanting a name in the wake of their fresh decisive victory—
'Exemplars'.
She certainly doesn't resemble her father.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Other than her golden hair... speaking of which, it's amusing how legitimate heirs to the Aslan royal line always sport such dazzling hair that you can see it shine from afar.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: You mean...
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Heh. Ah, Alexandrina. That girl might just be Victoria's chosen one.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: The ducal fleets are restructuring their formation...
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: They're...
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Slowing their pursuit?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: So that's why the cannons go all quiet?! What are they thinking? The Sarkaz only just retreated, so now's the best time to give them a thrashing!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: That's Gododdin's frigate.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: They're approaching... the wreck of Caster's flagship. Seems like he's taking the opportunity for a breather.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Just that?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: It's probably because he's scared the ship's going to take so long to repair that the Nachzehrers will rush onto the deck and devour them all.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: When's the last time we saw Londinium's walls?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Are they cracked wide open? Covered with Originium crystals? Or soaked in fresh blood, all covered with dead branches, or even inlaid with the bones of our people?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: When we got out of Norport, many of us might have thought that was the worst we'd experience.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: But afterwards we saw a deck flooded with blood, and went through a perilous time all thanks to the Originium.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: We watched as the war turned our city into an unrecognizable ruin.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Is there anyone who willing to puff out their chest and say they can imagine how the city looks like inside?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: The dukes' spies should have more information than we do.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: From their conduct, Caster and the others are probably preparing to abandon Londinium.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: A nomadic city wrecked by Sarkaz may be worth less than a fleet formed at a high price.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Also... the Shard has truly yet to fall. No one knows if the Sarkaz have any remaining tricks to try, or if another city will turn into a battlefield.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: More nobles might decide to move their troops back home.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Blast it! I knew they'd pull something like that!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Win a tough fight, and then not give a crap about what's gonna happen to Londinium!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Yes. As you say, that's what they'd definitely do. So it's just another ordinary day for Victoria.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: As for us—we've decided long ago what we should do, haven't we?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Siege walks into the crowd.
For a moment, she cannot discern if someone belongs to the Exemplars or was saved by them.
Everyone is exhausted, but they still hold their heads up high.
Siege knows she doesn't have to say much.
Because opened eyes will not close so easily anymore.
Everyone watches Siege.
Siege looks toward Londinium, their city, their people.
She lifts the hammer in her hand.
Exemplars—
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Advance!
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Enough... enough! Please, just withdraw the order!
attributes.name: Scared Sarkaz Soldier

attributes.content: The Shard has already stopped, so how can we go on fighting?
attributes.name: Scared Sarkaz Soldier

attributes.content: What else can we do now but to be smashed into paste by a high-speed battleship?
attributes.name: Scared Sarkaz Soldier

attributes.content: Shut up! Shut that *Sarkaz expletive* mouth of yours!
attributes.name: Low-Ranking Sarkaz Officer

attributes.content: We are at war, and this is the battlefield! Hide in here all you want, and some Feline will eventually lop your head off anyway!
attributes.name: Low-Ranking Sarkaz Officer

attributes.content: Pick up your blade! If we must die, we die with dignity!
attributes.name: Low-Ranking Sarkaz Officer

attributes.content: There's no other way we can go!
attributes.name: Low-Ranking Sarkaz Officer

attributes.content: What's going on...? Who else could use the Royal Court's frequency? Whose signal is this?
attributes.name: Low-Ranking Sarkaz Officer

attributes.content: Hello? Hello? Can anyone hear me?
Wiš'adel's the name—the one and only name granted by Her Highness The King of Sarkaz Theresa herself.
Every Sarkaz still under the Military Commission's command, listen up.
I don't care if you came here after hearing whatever nonsense from Theresis or some Royal Court geezer.
I'm delighted to announce: the war has ended, and you guys lost.
But Her Highness says she wants to have every Sarkaz return home.
So, if you want to live, it's time to ignore orders from the Military Commission and do as this transmission says.
Oh, I should've mentioned it earlier.
This is Babel.
Quick, follow me!
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: This path is safe, we haven't spotted any Sarkaz for the time being!
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: A transmission?
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Our own Exemplar frequency... Miss Closure!
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: I'm listening! Turn the volume up... some more...
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Everyone should be able to hear it now.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Wow... did I hear that right?
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: That Siege lady did it! She brought back our people with her, and together pave a way...
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: ...A way home.
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: We've sent a squad closest to their location over. Fang's squad is also on their way. She's the fastest out of them and can help us ensure the road stays clear.
attributes.name: Misery

attributes.content: Right.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Next, I just have to find a relatively safe spot for the rendezvous...
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: No need for that.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Miss Closure, we're quite close to the city walls.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Every maintenance access point... is inside my head.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Every member of the Self-Salvation Corps who pulled out from Londinium won't forget them.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: There are some very old passages the Sarkaz definitely have no clue about.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: We can go home.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: That frequency you care about is active.
attributes.name: Victorian Mercenary

attributes.content: Judging from their speed, they're practically rushing toward the city.
attributes.name: Victorian Mercenary

attributes.content: The passages the Sarkaz don't know about only number a few.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: They'll definitely pick the path closest to Highbury.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: Something happened in there before. Feist won't risk that with his party.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: It's probably K15. If they go through somewhere else, spread some news about Munitions Factory No. 11 and figure a way to lure them there.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: Same rules as usual?
attributes.name: Victorian Mercenary

attributes.content: Yes. Clean that path up as much as you can.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: And don't get spotted when we make a kill, yeah?
attributes.name: Victorian Mercenary

attributes.content: You're more wary with these regular workers and 'The Exemplars' than you are with the Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Victorian Mercenary

attributes.content: In case something does go awry, could you just let me know if you see them as friend or foe?
attributes.name: Victorian Mercenary

attributes.content: That doesn't matter. The person they knew is no longer here.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: That disgraceful traitor died in the Mausoleum of Kings, and... is no longer worthy of retrieving the glory they threw away themselves.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: She hears a faint familiar sound once more.
Again and again, agitating her eardrums and heart.
But there is no white steam in the sky at all.
Perhaps, it is merely the sound of Active Originium rapidly evaporating into the air.
That armor... did it fly away?
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: We haven't gotten any news.
attributes.name: Victorian Mercenary

attributes.content: The Sarkaz might have taken it apart, or maybe Originium buried it on the battlefield.
attributes.name: Victorian Mercenary

attributes.content: You achieved your goal for now by leading it to the Sighs of Kings to help the Exemplars out. But it's really difficult to control. Do we have to figure out a way to retrieve it?
attributes.name: Victorian Mercenary

attributes.content: Let's not risk ourselves with that yet.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: Sure, I mean, it might just pop out on its own accord whenever. Who knows what a mad ghost would want to do next?
attributes.name: Victorian Mercenary

attributes.content: Perhaps...
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: Or maybe, when next we meet, he can find a bit of... something that belongs to him.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: *cough* *cough* No, absolutely NOT! You know just how rare it is to find protective gear able to cope with high levels of Originium in Londinium nowadays!
attributes.name: Fretful Merchant

attributes.content: But, your price is just too—
attributes.name: Nervous Citizen

attributes.content: We have a lot of people in our community who needs these, so can't you just cut it down...?
attributes.name: Nervous Citizen

attributes.content: You just told me your wife and child have stones growing on them, and they can't bear with the pain—
attributes.name: Fretful Merchant

attributes.content: I'll be frank. Me too! Every night it gets so bloody painful I can't catch a wink!
attributes.name: Fretful Merchant

attributes.content: I suspect the same goes for everyone in this city. These wretched crystals are growing wantonly on everybody!
attributes.name: Fretful Merchant

attributes.content: Not to mention those devils anxiously running amok now.
attributes.name: Fretful Merchant

attributes.content: So, listen well. My price is fairer than fair. You're worried for your health, but I have to plan for my future.
attributes.name: Fretful Merchant

attributes.content: Columbia's private sanatoriums don't come cheap. I know a director there who's a cunning scoundrel, and I only hope he doesn't con me out of my coin.
attributes.name: Fretful Merchant

attributes.content: I also have to pay my servants, my chef...
attributes.name: Fretful Merchant

attributes.content: What's going on?!
attributes.name: Fretful Merchant

attributes.content: Mr. Hall, they're currently—
attributes.name: Security Detail

attributes.content: Have the Sarkaz found us? Hurry, get moving! And push out those paupers still clinging around our doorway to buy some time! Those devils can't tell whose lives are more valuable!
attributes.name: Fretful Merchant

attributes.content: No, that's not it! They're not Sarkaz!
attributes.name: Security Detail

attributes.content: Blast it, they've smashed in our warehouse wall! Now everyone's rushing in to grab the goods inside and we can't stop them!
attributes.name: Security Detail

attributes.content: What do I pay you for?! Where are your electrical nets and heavy crossbows? I don't care if you attract some Sarkaz as long as you keep the goods safe!
attributes.name: Fretful Merchant

attributes.content: B-But they have fire on their side—
attributes.name: Security Detail

attributes.content: Fire?
attributes.name: Fretful Merchant

attributes.content: Good day, Mr. Hall.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: ...I know you people—
attributes.name: Fretful Merchant

attributes.content: 'Reunion', right? The city has been all abuzz about your group these past few days.
attributes.name: Fretful Merchant

attributes.content: Listen to me, Reunion. I don't know why there's a misunderstanding between us—I'm Infected too!
attributes.name: Fretful Merchant

attributes.content: We're basically family, right? We can work together!
attributes.name: Fretful Merchant

attributes.content: Just name a price—how much for you to be my bodyguards?
attributes.name: Fretful Merchant

attributes.content: Reunion does not accept employment offers.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Then—ngh, what about a share of my sales? Or a donation?
attributes.name: Fretful Merchant

attributes.content: I can make a donation as an Infected! The city's Infected need all of these urgently, aren't we the people you fight for?
attributes.name: Fretful Merchant

attributes.content: Heh. 'Donation'? That's not the tune you were whistling earlier.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: I see, I get it now. I should have thought of it earlier.
attributes.name: Fretful Merchant

attributes.content: Ha! Of course, of course... everyone would want all of this for themselves—you're just capitalizing on another crime!
attributes.name: Fretful Merchant

attributes.content: You want to set the score? Sure, I'll begin.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Stewart Hall. You applied for a huge subsidy every year for protective equipment because your factory processes Originium.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: But your workers have never seen a single garb of protective gear you've accumulated. The Infected living in the outskirts of town—just how many of them were your workers who were kicked out from your factory?
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Meanwhile, you stuffed yourself with Columbian pioneer company meetings. Failing to send all these gear out before war broke out in Londinium must have cost you a pretty penny.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: But you still thought yourself lucky. Londinium's done for, and the protective suits you almost deemed a loss came in handy once again.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: You... just what do you people want?! Are you not a group that liberates the Infected? Look, just look at the stones all over my body—
attributes.name: Fretful Merchant

attributes.content: Physical illness is not the source of the Infected's suffering—it is injustice.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Your luck has run out, Mr. Hall.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Because Reunion is here.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: You're Talulah, right? I've heard of you, it's all thanks to you—
attributes.name: Nervous Citizen

attributes.content: Just doing what I should do.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: This is a lot of protective suits we have here. We'll have to distribute them...
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Even if infection is inevitable for some, this equipment can slow the disease's progression for those already sick. At the very least, they won't suddenly explode into bits from continuous exposure in a high level Originium zone.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: But most Infected choose to hide in their homes, so they wouldn't know who to ask for help even if their condition gets terribly dire, right?
attributes.name: Londinium Worker A

attributes.content: So let us go look for them.
attributes.name: Londinium Worker A

attributes.content: Tommy, you know how dangerous that is.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Of course. That odd thing hanging above the Shard seems to be gone, and the sky seems to have lightened up a little.
attributes.name: Londinium Worker A

attributes.content: Guess the Sarkaz are having some trouble. Our blokes are saying a huge amount of Sarkaz are retreating into the city.
attributes.name: Londinium Worker A

attributes.content: They're also swarming the spot where that flying fortress fell. According to the current alert level, going out is practically suicide.
attributes.name: Londinium Worker A

attributes.content: Then you still—
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: We were doomed long ago, right?
attributes.name: Londinium Worker A

attributes.content: ...I understand.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: My brother lives in County Castshire, you've met him. If I don't make it back, just give my wrench to him. If... if possible, tell him I was a...
attributes.name: Londinium Worker A

attributes.content: Nah, forget it. Tell him nothing.
attributes.name: Londinium Worker A

attributes.content: Also, Catherine. My stance towards you, Feist, the Self-Salvation Corps and Rhodes Islanders has never changed.
attributes.name: Londinium Worker A

attributes.content: There's no meaning in saying that. What's happened won't change.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: But you can influence and change whatever's yet to happen, kid.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Hah!
attributes.name: Londinium Worker A

attributes.content: Then... we're all good to go.
attributes.name: Londinium Worker A

attributes.content: That's quite brave of them.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: You've spent quite some time staring at some of those punks.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: They turned their backs on us. Reunion nearly collapsed because of traitors.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: These few fellas didn't shake things up too much. Is there anyone who has never been confused in their life?
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: We have our own rules.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: There are other places that could use your help, but you'll go over anyway, right?
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Save your strength, avoid combat, go get some suits from Percival and keep yourself safe.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: How did you know—
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: No, forget it.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Thanks.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: That went smoothly. Quite a number recognized you and your fire, Talulah.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: I already put the shackles back on.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: If only they could see my flames as hope.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Now, we have a literal city of Infected.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Can you find a shadow of your former ideals in it?
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Only rubble and ruin everywhere I look.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Even we Infected live in our vastly different lives. We suffer from the same disease, but never the same kind of suffering.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: This is why Reunion has to be here.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: If the Infected are born from injustice, then we... will stand against all injustice.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: You're finally back! Are you hurt, child? The Sarkaz didn't spot you, did they?
attributes.name: Londinium Resident

attributes.content: I'm fine. Thank you for letting me stay here. I brought some food back with me.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: How are you feeling today?
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: There's more stones, but it's fine. It doesn't hurt. An old lady like me never had much long to live anyway.
attributes.name: Londinium Resident

attributes.content: But a group came by while you were gone. They're good people, they gave me a checkup, and I asked them to come back in a bit to examine you too—
attributes.name: Londinium Resident

attributes.content: A checkup? Were they doctors?
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: (Rhodes Island should be in the city by now, but I haven't managed to reconnect with them. If that was them...)
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Doctors? I'm not sure, but they told me to look for a place with flames if I needed any help.
attributes.name: Londinium Resident

attributes.content: Flames?
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Oh! You're back!
attributes.name: Londinium Resident

attributes.content: This girl has helped me so much. She's infected too, so take her with you for an examination.
attributes.name: Londinium Resident

attributes.content: So it's you.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: It's been a long time, Ch'en.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: The artisans who carved the giant statues here many years ago, never could have imagined the guards of the royal mausoleum collapse into rubble due to the Sarkaz, instead of standing for eternity together with Victoria.
The Feranmut's skeleton emerges from deep underground, landing with a few lucky survivors.
'Ines...where... are we?'
It's too quiet. We're not on a battlefield... Ines... Ines?!
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Ines! Ines! Hoederer's awake!
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: Paprika...? Where are we? Where're Ines and W? What's become of the battlefield now? *cough* *cough* Did they recapture the Lifebone already?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Uh... we're currently underground with many stone giants...
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: Um... Ines is... W went with the others...
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: Wait, hold on, that's too many questions at once—
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: You recovered quicker than I thought.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: I thought he'd be more ruthless with you.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: ...What of him?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Who knows, Ascalon might have already killed him.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Hmph, don't give me that look.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: It's good for us if he's really dead.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: But Ines—
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: Paprika, now's not the time.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Okay...
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: Currently, we've stopped the Lifebone in the Mausoleum of Kings. W followed the Doctor and the others to stop the airship, but we don't know how they're doing.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: The Mausoleum of Kings? Are you sure—
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: I recognize the Steam Knights' equipment.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: There's also plenty of Sarkaz remains here, so if my hunch is right...
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: This is where the Steam Knights were surrounded and killed back then.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Any other clues?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: I did find something.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Take a look.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: This is... clothing?
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: Found it on a relatively intact Sarkaz skeleton.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: I thought it might jog your memories.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: There's a word embroidered in the lining!
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: ...'Julie'?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: 'Julie'? Hoederer, did you know them?
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: Hoederer shakes his head.
There aren't many Sarkaz with names, and there's no anybody involved in the slaughter here was ordinary.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: She left her name here, and it should have stayed undiscovered forever.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: But we chanced upon her.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: What she and others did here will ultimately be remembered by us.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: But it sounds like... it wasn't something to be happy about.
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: We already have more than enough of our own buried in this foreign country after all. How many of them can we remember when everything's over?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: So what next? Your injury—
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Wiš'adel... war... ended—live...
attributes.name: *Radio Noise*

attributes.content: ...*bzzt*...This is Babel.
attributes.name: *Radio Noise*

attributes.content: Wiš'a...del? Who?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: That sounded like—
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Hmph. What's she up to this time?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: ...Have we received any more intelligence from outside the battlefield?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: (Shakes head nervously)
attributes.name: Paprika
Hoederer
attributes.content: I fear we might have missed out on something very important—

attributes.name: Hoederer
attributes.content: Grr... He really did try to kill me.
attributes.joined: I fear we might have missed out on something very important—Grr... He really did try to kill me.

attributes.content: Give yourself some time to heal.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: I won't die just yet. Our top priority is to contact the Doctor and W.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: If she wasn't lying in that transmission... then she really needs us now.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: It seems like the battle has gone way past how I expected it to go.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Regent, Theresa... what exactly have you two done...?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.options: Kal'tsit, the backup plan is working.;We escaped to the underground passage, covered by the chaos of the airship's crash landing.

attributes.content: We went through so much in the Assimilated Universe, but Originium's special nature means we were only gone for a brief moment.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: This will likewise be a sudden change for the Military Commission.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: It could be a chance for us.

attributes.content: Indeed. Communications are being restored, and the ducal alliance will speed up their advance. I don't think the Military Commission will stand a chance against a surrounding offensive from the alliance.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: A proactive attack from us might bring greater results, if we rely on the contact points within the city she strived to preserve.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: It was only because she put herself in danger during this time...
That our backup plan managed to proceed without a hitch.

attributes.content: She did well.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I'd love to hear from Kal'tsit in private about what your group went through, but it really isn't the best time for that.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: To be honest, it was all I could do to bring you out of the chaos.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Many of those in the city saw the airship crash, and everyone has been guessing who's done it.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Doctor, you may find it hard to imagine the joy... when you suddenly see hope within the long dark night...
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.options: It sounds like it'll benefit our operations in the city.

attributes.content: I wouldn't call it a 'benefit'. At most it means more possibilities for us.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Heidi, how did contacting Closure go?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Communications are still being restored, and the city's taken a big hit. We're pressed for time too.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: W... no, she insisted I call her Wiš'adel...
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: She said she received a transmission from her subordinates, and took off to verify it. I... couldn't stop her.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: No matter. She knows very well what she should be doing.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Also, check your belongings. She must have left a way for us to contact her.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Huh...?
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: There really is!... When did she leave this beacon on me...?
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.options: That's very much her style of doing things.
How are Amiya and Logos doing?

attributes.content: The next area hasn't been swept clear yet. Once they confirm it's safe, we'll evacuate to the next safe point at once.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Doctor, Amiya, she...
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.options: Don't worry about her.;She just needs some time.

attributes.content: Alright. I'll try my best to get in touch with more of our friends inside the city. We'll need their help.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.options: I also just compiled all the information we know.;Sync that data with Closure once you manage to connect with her.
I also uploaded arrangements for the other Rhodes Island Operators onto PRTS.;Tell them to update their PRTS as soon as they can so everyone's on the same page.

attributes.content: Seizing the opportunity?
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.options: Yes.;Currently, every faction in Londinium has their own blind spots.;It's a chance for us to buy time and react to anything in advance.

attributes.content: Understood. I'll handle it—I'm the one most familiar with the rebuilt intracity network after all.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: You may not have noticed, Doctor. But you've become more proactive ever since we left the Assimilated Universe.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: ...Is that so?

attributes.content: Is it due to the first Originium?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You've become somewhat impatient ever since you met Theresa and learned some truths I'm unable to speak of.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: ...;I don't think it's a bad thing.

attributes.content: I still have my own reservations, but what's important now is to stay clear-headed, and make your judgments.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: I... why did I betray Theresa back then?

attributes.content: Only Theresa knows the truth to that.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I will not make any further comments on that incident. But it does not mean my anger towards that event is no more.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: However... Doctor, you have proven yourself to me, to us.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You have walked on the same path as us to where we are today, that's enough to prove that Theresa made the right decision.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: So, there's no need to be trapped by your past self. Besides, you know absolutely nothing about everything that happened then.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: That's precisely why... I can't comprehend Theresa's choice at all.
But from her few sentences...
I have a suspicion that fills me with fear.;I have a guess as to what my own mission is.
I'm a savior of this land.;I'm a destroyer of this land.

attributes.content: If that is your post-reflection conclusion, I have no objections.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: But the you I see before me is still far away from accomplishing that.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The path ahead of us is still very, very long... no, perhaps we don't have much time left.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Doctor, the future will not wait for us to be ready before it comes.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: But I will follow you with Rhodes Island down this path.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: ...Can you really say that now with such a calm tone?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You're hesitating. You have doubts.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: That was never your true self. Do not let unwarranted speculation disturb your present determination.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: We determine who we are by our actions than our words. No matter how long we spend hesitating before we reach the end.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The future will answer me, Doctor.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I am now more willing to follow you down your path.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: We will witness it together.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: But now, our key focus should be on the thing that can turn the tides of war.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: The first Originium.;'Amnannam'.

attributes.content: Theresa would only hand it over to someone she trusts the most, no matter how the Sarkaz are faring.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Theresa's trust towards Theresis has never changed—they have never truly diverged from one another.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: What we currently face is still within the scope of their plan.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: Theresis...

attributes.content: We have unfinished tasks to get to.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: We don't know what Theresis plans to do with a weapon that can easily change this land.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: There is reason to believe it will not be a gentle method.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: We need to stop him.
Originium has something to do with me.;I can't absolve myself from the atrocities that happened in Londinium either.;Perhaps this is my mission.
Did you just... smile?

attributes.content: No. Now, have you decided our next course of action, Doctor?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: Ha, I have a rough idea in mind.;I'll need your help.

attributes.text: 'Now, the Sarkaz have only one choice left to make, Theresa.'
'Yes... our people have already made their choice.'
'I will fulfil the promise made between us, I will help you.'
'Why do you sigh? I know if I won, you would stand by my side without a shred of hesitation. Isn't that right...'

attributes.content: Theresis can no longer hear her voice.
She is gone, but her answer to the future remains.
The first Originium fell from the Shard's peak, traversed the barrier, and landed in the Palace of Westhaleg's subterranean throne room...
The answer already lies in the palm of his hand.
You wrested the key to freedom for the Sarkaz from its arrogant creator.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: As you promised me you would.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: But I... lost you, completely.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Theresa, you've fulfilled your promise, so how could I resign myself to walk in your shadow?
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: I will continue ahead on the path you were halfway through to the end—
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: To retrieve what is ours from those who believe they dictate our fate.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: I shall judge that arrogant sin.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: And this land ought to revere us—
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: This war, to him, has already ended. And as for the future, the rest will bear witness.
He ignores the ancient seat of Victorian kings caked in dust, and steps into an unknowable darkness.
Theresa has already opened for him, the 'door' to the truth.
He looks forward to what he'll find beyond that door—who will be there to welcome him?
'I have a question. Phantom of a bygone age, who boasts yourself a giant, a god, a supreme creator, one who can dictate the fate of the Sarkaz. Are you truly the only one of your kind...'
'...Dr. {@nickname}?'
